intro: Cota tinctoria subsp. subtinctoria, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for garden cultivation. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental beauty and historical use in traditional dyeing practices.
